website_summaries.verdict: Unlike stainless steel grinders, this acrylic-bodied grinder gives you a great view of what's going on with your grinding.
pros: Professional nutmeg grinder holds 4-6 whole nutmegs.Features three stainless steel serrated blades and powerful claw to ensure a fine grind.Unique lift and deliver system guarantees next nutmeg will drop into place
Made from high-quality, crystal clear acrylic
Keeps good pressure on the nut to grind
cons: May not totally grind the nut down, but the nut must be removed to grind a new one

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect and totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Nutmeg grinders are hard to find. Especially good ones. To me, grated fingertips are not worth the hand grinding option, and the round graters are horrid. But THIS one is AWESOME!!! It holds a lot of extra nutmeg, which are super easy to move over to start grating, and the spring is strong so it does an incredible job of keeping the pressure on the nut to get a good grind. The only problem I've had is that if you accidentally get two nuts over to the grinder side, it won't grind and it's REALLY hard to get the 2nd nut out of there. And fresh ground nutmeg is so much more amazing than canned stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Mouriana

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For being a Cole & Mason product I was really looking forward to using this for quick grinding of nutmeg seeds with a high quality design. The design is flawed as it begins to have issues as the final tip of the nutmeg begins to near the shaving mechanism it tends to spin and not shave any more. If that didn't happen the claw that grasps the nutmeg would begin to carve a circle into the top of the seed instead of hold it in place for proper shaving... Pretty disappointing as other products I've used by Cole & Mason are spectacular. Skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: R Granados

customer_reviews.title: Unitasker that I love
customer_reviews.text: I never imagined myself with one of these. I always thought, why would I want a unitasker like a nutmeg grinder. Then someone said "If you have a pepper mill for pepper, why not a nutmeg mill for nutmeg" and I started to be swayed. After finding myself not using nutmeg because I did not want to wash my microplane I was convinced and I ordered this. And I am glad I did. The good: - Holds 6-7 nutmeg fruits - Grinds smoothly - Loads the next nutmeg without a second though The ok: - Takes 0.75 as long as my microplane to grind the same amount of nutmeg. I was hoping for faster All in all I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Yogesh A. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Made in China NOT England
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these grinders (one for me, one for my sister) and chose this particular item because the description stated that it came with a lifetime guarantee was from England. I'm happy about the guarantee and love the grinder . The grinder is imported to England; it is not manufactured there. The grinder in made in China and this disappoints me!
customer_reviews.author: Nannan

customer_reviews.title: It was good for only one nutmeg
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product one star because you have to give it one star in order to submit a review. Needless to say it doesn't rate any stars. It was good for only one nutmeg. Then it stopped working. I cleaned the blades (what a pain), it then worked for 2 more turns of the grinder when it stopped grinding. This happened again and again, as the blades kept getting clogged. After repeating this procedure a number of times I had to throw it out before insanity set in! Don't waste your money or time or you sanity! Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Columbia

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. This product jams all the time and the blade that shaves/grinds becomes dull very quickly (after a week or two of daily use). I wish I could get my money back and they can have the grinder back. Poor quality and product life.
customer_reviews.author: Yanilda

customer_reviews.title: It worked for one year
customer_reviews.text: After a year, the spring sprung. I only used it to grate nutmeg. When it worked, it worked well. It was not easy to put in the spices, but once you do, it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: RJWilson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like how easy this grater is to use. It's also great that it stores several nutmegs so that I don't have to go to my spice cabinet for more during baking larger batches of foods. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Sewer

customer_reviews.title: "Professional" should be removed from the title
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality of design. Nuts would not stay in place, cutting blade easily clogged, and the metal bottom separated from the plastic after the third attempt using with no way to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: No instructions to come with it. Had to figure out that I had to pull up the handle to place the nutmeg under for it to work. Product broke off on its on while simply sitting on my countertop. Literally had nutmegs flying all over the place. For the price I thought it would be much more sturdy. Overall though I like the presentation of it. Really nice as a display piece. Would love to be as functional as it is pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Yinett

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Finally figured how to get a nutmeg into the grinder side. Now In know how, and I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Old Shoe

customer_reviews.title: Makes the creamiest Cappuccino I have ever enjoyed
customer_reviews.text: My husband made this purchase knowing I love a good Cappuccino and this is the best Espresso machine I have owned I will always be a Nespresso consumer Thsnks
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Not Great. Not Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Interesting and stylish. Doesn't do a great job of grinding. Difficult to make the next nut go into the grinding chamber. I have tried several other grinders, and have yet to find one that is great. This is an close as I have gotten.
customer_reviews.author: David Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great for Nutmeg
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a nutmeg grater and have tried several but these are the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Nutmeg Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This nutmeg grinder is easy to use, and also stores additional whole nutmegs. The ground nutmeg is course. I like to add it to egg nog, oatmeal, cookies and cakes. I haven't tried it in my coffee, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Actually works and does not stop working like some nutmeg grinders .
customer_reviews.author: Anne alicia

customer_reviews.title: Nutmeg grinder
customer_reviews.text: I got this to have fresh nutmeg on hand. DELIGHTFUL. Thanks for selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nutmeg Lovers
customer_reviews.text: This nutmeg grinder is beautiful PLUS it makes the nutmeg lightweight & therefore more of the oil essence. HIGHLY recommend!

customer_reviews.title: Fresh ground Nutmeg at your fingertips
customer_reviews.text: Practical storage for nutmeg with excellent grinding for fresh flavor

customer_reviews.title: Stores the excess nutmeg nuts within itself.
customer_reviews.text: It is attractive and functional. Like it better than the single nut version which we accidentally dropped on a tiled floor consequently shattering. It is simple to use and requires no batteries which is a plus in lite of the ecological situation we find ourselves in.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Dittmar

customer_reviews.title: No suitable to grind nutmeg
customer_reviews.text: Broke on first usage grinding nutmeg for which it was made. Very expensive bad decision.

customer_reviews.title: It produces fresh ground nutmeg easily

customer_reviews.title: Try above price point the lesser are cheaper. Maybe metal
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just over a year. And while watching TV the base unbonded and fell apart on the shelf falling to the floor. Since I am logging also very hard to utilize whole nutmeg. The teeth to grip fail when the bladed catch hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered as a gift for my mom who loves to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift for my mom who loves to cook. She uses it often and even travels with it! It does sometimes get stuck but it does not bother her.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: Really great...until the massive amount of pressure between these two pieces of plastic released and it broke. Such a disappointment. Don't bother. It will break.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Wollschlager

customer_reviews.title: I does not close when you try to use it.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I started the product broke. I introduced the nuts and the pressure inside uncovered the bottom of the product. It does not close, but it opens. It is impossible to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Easy use
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about this item Easy to use and great way to store xtra nuts
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and was super easy to use. The one time I got to use it. I didn't get more than one use out of it. No matter what I did, I could get any nutmeg shavings. It was like something wasn't quite connecting. I don't know. It's possible it is a user error, but I can't figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Tina S

customer_reviews.title: This Nutmeg Grater doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: The design looks good, holding quite a few nutmegs so you don't have to keep refilling it. The problem is that the nutmegs don't feed into the grinding mechanism very well and it's hard work to get shavings onto your food. You do get some but it's very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful. I was using a hand grater
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful. I was using a hand grater. Its so nice to get fresh nutmeg with no finger nails in it , LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: regret this purchase, not strong enough to grind a nutmeg another cheapo product into the landfill :(

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK DO NOT BUY

customer_reviews.title: No way to fix it,
customer_reviews.text: This broke on the second nutmeg... not worth them money

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This nutmeg grinder is really cute. It is also very easy to use. I leave it out in the open in my kitchen. I have never used whole nutmeg before, I thought it would be complicated, I was so wrong. This product stores and easily grinds all you need. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: finnmom

customer_reviews.title: Best Nutmeg Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the nutmeg grater(cheese grater style) for years and just got tired of how irritating it was to use and how you can never use up all of a nut. This grinder works so well. It sort of shaves the nutmeg finely while also storing several for later. It looks lovely as well.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, good quality and practical!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased and I like that I can store the nutmegs in it. It’s sturdy and and overall a pleasure to use.

customer_reviews.title: Brings him far too much joy every time he uses it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my dad. Brings him far too much joy every time he uses it, so I guess that deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: mash

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: I love fresh nutmeg and this works so-so . Seems solid but doesn't hold nut in place for a consistent grind..
customer_reviews.author: Louis Heller

customer_reviews.title: Lovely design
customer_reviews.text: I like how extra nuts can be stored. It took a little practice to get the hang of grinding, but I'm doing fine with it now. Beautiful design, it looks nice on the shelf, and just the right size for holding in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: EABaldwin

customer_reviews.title: bottom fell out before first use. Big problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: bottom fell out before first use. Big problem with product design. Don't buy!! soon or later, the bottom will fall off because it was glue on and the spring that push the nut down is constantly giving the pressure to the glued bottom.
customer_reviews.author: BY

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart!!!
customer_reviews.text: Could not read the instructions, even a magnify glass. Tried to work it and it fell apart!

customer_reviews.title: Grinder loses its grip with the nut
customer_reviews.text: Grinder loses its grip with the nut. You have to keep repositioning the nut to get a few flakes before it starts slipping again. Very frustrating to use. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: C. MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Love the grinder
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. It does not grind into a powder but very tiny flakes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Operate
customer_reviews.text: I am able to work this nutmeg grinder with no trouble. My other nutmeg grinder got too hard for me to close and I have no trouble with this model.

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: It looks great, but not 100 percent easy to see

customer_reviews.title: Great grind, easy to turn
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. It gives a great grind and is easy to turn. I have gone through 75% of one nutmeg and it was perfectly smooth the whole way through.

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to fill and use. no more ruining my manicure.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Welsh

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Works good for 1 use, after that, you have to clean everytime..

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't grind my nutmegs most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time, I can't get it to work at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Siporin

customer_reviews.title: Won't Grind
customer_reviews.text: Very dissappointed in this product. While it appears to be a convenient design, after a day or two, this product would not grind any more. It is very difficult to get the nutmeg back out to clear and clean it and after doing so it still will not grind. Total waste of money. DONT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: slmcpa

customer_reviews.title: I chose Cole & Mason because I have had good experiences with the brand for salt/pepper grinders
customer_reviews.text: Works well so far (have gone through 1 nut), grind is medium coarseness. This is my first nutmeg grinder, I chose Cole & Mason because I have had good experiences with the brand for salt/pepper grinders.
customer_reviews.author: M. King

customer_reviews.title: Its not love its nutmeg
customer_reviews.text: By far one of the best spice grinders I have ever used and it has a stylish design. Looks good and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Had I used it sooner and discovered its shortcomings, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor design. Makes grinding nutmeg berries difficult to impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: great design but does not catch the nutmeg and therefore ...
customer_reviews.text: lovely appearance, great design but does not catch the nutmeg and therefore fails to grate so it does not meet its primary function
customer_reviews.author: Irene Gunning

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but too many problems.
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, but poorly made and doesn't work well. It works brilliantly at first. The bottom was pushed out eventually by the spring loaded piston and, much to my surprise, it was simply glued in place. I re-glued it, but it popped out again. The blade that creates the shaving also gets gummed up and has to be removed with a jewler's screwdriver. Finally, depending on how the nutmeg "nut" begins to change shape as it grinds, it can keep being pushed back into the nutmeg chute. I was so impressed at first, but now have thrown both out. Such a nice design. Pity.
customer_reviews.author: Ecologist

customer_reviews.title: Must remove all remanence of used nut before using a ...
customer_reviews.text: Must remove all remanence of used nut before using a new one, or new nut will not rotate against cutting surface. It can be very hard to clean out the cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E.

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck getting your whole nutmeg out of the darn ...
customer_reviews.text: This is Very difficult to use. Add to that once you manage to get the nutmeg in place (Very Difficult), all the grinder does is spin the nutmeg around in a circle. Does NOT grate it!! After that.....Good Luck getting your whole nutmeg out of the darn thing. AWFUL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Bays

customer_reviews.title: No longer grinds the nutmeg.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item December 2016. It worked fine for a while, but it stopped working last month. It no longer grinds the nutmeg. I have taken the nutmeg out and tried to see if there was something jammed in it. That was not the case, it just stopped working. I think if you pay this amount of money for an item like this, it should work longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: F. M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Bottom fell off.
customer_reviews.text: I believe the spring used in the grinder is more powerful than needed. The constant pressure made the base separate from the grinder while it was sitting on the shelf. It worked beautifully and I trusted the brand. I decided to super glue the base on and will use it until the nutmeg runs out. Such a silly design error. It was practically new.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Came Unglued
customer_reviews.text: This grinder likely works very well and is very straighforward. However, before I used it for the first time, the bottom black plastic piece came unglued. Found it by my stove with the nutmeg nuts all around. I will need to reglue it I guess.
customer_reviews.author: D. Leander

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! I read the instructions and followed them several times. It never worked. Never ground the nutmeg. What a waste. I should have returned it sooner and gotten a refund, but I kept hoping I could get it to work. Boy, was I wrong.
customer_reviews.author: CPN

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I love freshly ground nutmeg on lots of different foods; especially on mashed potatoes. This is my second purchase of this particular device. It works like a charm once you get the hang of it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: O. Bossman

customer_reviews.title: i bought the more expensive nutmeg grinder but like this one much better
customer_reviews.text: the grinder works well. seems very sharp and takes up less room in the cabinet than the more expensive one. well made
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: One part broke as soon as I got it. ...
customer_reviews.text: One part broke as soon as I got it. I thought I would use it anyway but as other reviewers have said, it is impossible to move the next hazelnut forward and all this grinder does is go round and round without grinding anything. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Best nutmeg grinder
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for a couple years, but my roommate's been hogging it in his room, so I ordered a second one to live in the kitchen. The grinder mechanism is reliable and easy to use. The fact that it's spring loaded and easy to release means that, even with the nut almost gone, one can re-seat the crank's teeth into the nut and get the last little bit out.
customer_reviews.author: Max K

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work as well as the short one I have. I wanted this one because I thought it would be easier to hold on to while I was grinding but it kept getting clogged. Had to take the bottom off to rearrange the nutmeg a lot. Put it away & I'm back to using my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Hildy

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to useless
customer_reviews.text: HARD to get nutmeg under vise and then it has a tendency to get stuck in a spot that renders the grinder useless without taking it apart. Wish I had splurged and bought a true grinder.

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a couple weeks then not worked less and less.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for nutmeg

customer_reviews.title: Love it!

customer_reviews.text: fresh nutmeg is the only way to go and the Cole and Mason is the perfect way to grate nutmeg. for years I have grated my fingers on the little semi -circular graters, or the grates didn't do the job well enough. with this grinder I don't need to handle the nutmeg and it grinds perfectly and quickly

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why but it does not work like my first mill that fell and broke

customer_reviews.title: Easy & safe.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good since Christmas 2017. Does exactly what it purports to do.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works smoothly and provides a place for extra nutmegs. It makes finishing baked old fashioned custard pies with the fresh spice really tidy.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Spent a lot of time trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Spent a lot of time trying to grind nutmeg in my general spice grinder (hand crank coffee style) with no luck. Took a while to realize you have to pull up on the handle to load one.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing

I've tried all sorts of different nutmegs so that's not the problem. I bought this for more than $13 less than it is listed for now .... I wouldn't take it for free today.

customer_reviews.text: It does not grind like I expected. I still use my old grater, waste of money.

customer_reviews.title: Just NUTS over this one!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! When our old nutmeg grater fell and shattered, I went online to Amazon and found this beauty. Good solid construction and I love the fact that I can store additional nuts just ready for grating by pulling up on the handle, a bit stiff because of the strong spring, and having a new nut roll into place. Ingenious! I can finally enjoy my Fettucini Alfredo again.

customer_reviews.title: Really well made. I was a little confused with ...
customer_reviews.text: Really well made. I was a little confused with the instructions at first (absolute user error!) and it seems frivolous to have such a thing, but it really is a time saver and keeps nutmeg fresh too!

customer_reviews.title: I love this small grinder

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Works great after a couple of years of fairly regular use. A must for a nutmeg fanatic like me! Freshly ground nutmeg is so much better and this is a very sleek way to dish it out.

customer_reviews.title: Only works briefly. Fails soon after. Do not ...
customer_reviews.text: Only works briefly. Fails soon after. Do not purchase. Heed this advice.

product_meta.title: COLE & MASON Professional Nutmeg Spice Grinder
product_meta.description: Cole and Mason's Professional Nutmeg Grinder is the perfect tool to add fresh grated nutmeg to all culinary dishes. This fantastic high quality acrylic mill features the most powerful claw in town. It has three stainless steel serrated blades which also ensure the best grinding ever. To top it off there is a unique 'lift and deliver' system to guarantee the next nutmeg will drop into place. 4 to 6 nutmegs can be stored - amazing. Mill measures 6-Inch tall. Cole & Mason, part of the DKB Group, has been designing and developing kitchenware from its head office in England for almost a century. It has a well-established salt and pepper range, with a product for every job, from cooking to serving and eating, including manual and electronic mills, simple shakers and salt pigs (salt keepers), all manufactured with the highest quality materials and available in a wide choice of finishes.
feature_bullets: Professional nutmeg grinder holds 4-6 whole nutmegs
Features 3 stainless steel serrated blades and powerful claw to ensure a fine grind
Unique lift and deliver system guarantees next nutmeg will drop into place
Made from high quality, crystal clear acrylic
Lifetime guarantee on grinder; by Cole and Mason
